definition: to yield interest, profit etc/to exhale (Buddhism)
future prospects/profit/to mature/to grow up

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]

sentences.english: Degenhart also predicted that Einstein "would never get anywhere in life."
sentences.chinese: 狄根哈特还预言爱因斯坦“永远不会有出息”。

sentences.english: A bunch of sissies, quit it.
sentences.chinese: 一群没出息的家伙，给我停手。

sentences.english: The Wangs consider their son a black sheep.
sentences.chinese: 王家的人认为他们的儿子没有出息。

sentences.english: His son turned out successful after all.
sentences.chinese: 他的儿子最终变得很有出息。

sentences.english: That futile young man does nothing but waste money.
sentences.chinese: 那个没出息的青年人只会浪费钱。

sentences.english: A person without ambition is said to be shiftless .
sentences.chinese: 没有雄心的人被称为没出息的或者懒惰的人。

sentences.english: Don't marry that good for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 别嫁给那个没出息的人。

sentences.english: My son is such a good for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 我儿子是个没出息的人。

sentences.english: John won't get far if he is lazy.
sentences.chinese: 约翰如果这样懒将不会有出息。

sentences.english: To hide such a bad habit from one's family is pathetic.
sentences.chinese: 试图向家人隐瞒这种坏习惯，真没出息。

sentences.english: That smart guy is really a good for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 那狡猾的家伙真是个没出息的人。

sentences.english: People do not work for nothing, people do not learn no progress.
sentences.chinese: 人不劳动没出息，人不学习没长进。

sentences.english: Unpromising people do not work; people do not study and did not progress.
sentences.chinese: 人不劳动没出息，人不学习没长进。

sentences.english: Fortunately he had a younger brother who was more promising .
sentences.chinese: 幸运的是，他有个弟弟比他有出息。

sentences.english: I don ' t think he can go far.
sentences.chinese: 他是个见异思迁的人，我认为他不会有什么出息。

definition: source material/original story
ability/skill
to bring honor to one's ancestors
splendor shines on the family's door (idiom)/fig. to bring honor to one's family
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
hopes/good prospects
to stand out among one's peers (idiom)/to excel
to live comfortably/happy and prosperous life
family property
good fortune/a blessing
sth to strive for/prospect
to work hard for sth/to resolve on improvement/determined not to fall short
to make progress/progress
to have no aspirations (idiom)/unambitious
sensible/thoughtful/intelligent
maiden/unmarried woman/daughter
filial/dutiful/devoted to one's parents (and grandparents etc)/to show filial piety towards (an older family member)/filial piety
